ags:resource.dc:title: Eliminácia degradácie pôdnej štruktúry správnym minerálnym hnojením v rodiacom vinohrade

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: The elimination of soil structure degradation with using the optimal dose of mineral fertilizers in vineyard

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak University of Agriculture, Nitra, Slovak Republic

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In this work is analyzed soil samples from Rendzic Leptosol (Iocality - Dražovce - experiment with different soil management practices) collected from three treatments of fertilization: 1. K (non-fertilized control), 2. TTP + NPK1 (grass + 1st intensity of fertilization for vineyards), and 3. TTP + NPK3 (grass + 3rd intensity of fertilization for vineyards) during the years 2008- 2015. The effect of inorganic fertilization on parameters of soil structure (vulnerability, stability) was studied. Obtained results showed that overall, in TTP + NPK3 and in TTP + NPK1 the values of vulnerability coefficient were higher than control treatment by 6% and 10%, respectively. Positive effects of 1st intensity of fertilization for vineyards were observed in index of aggregate stability as well as in values of critical level of soil organic matter (St). Added nutrients in 3rd intensity of fertilization for vineyards decreased values of crusting index by 8% in comparison to control and TTP + NPK1 treatment. Positive statistically significant correlations were observed between the St and contents of soil organic carbon (r = 0.999
P s 0.001). Lower values of colour quotient of humus substances resulted in higher stability of soil aggregates (r = -0,483
P s 0.05) and in lower soil structure vulnerability (r = 0,485
P s 0.05). Higher quality of soil organic matter (r = -0.602, P s 0.001) were connected with lower formation of soil crust.
